en.sc1: Class MHCArrayList stores the list elements in the first size contiguous array positions. In this example, size is 5 and capacity is 8.
en.sc2: Array positions correspond to list positions. In other words, the element at position $i$ in the list is stored at array cell $i$. Here, the element at position 3 in the list (and index 3 in the array) is highlighted.
en.sc3: Note that the list begins indexing at position 0, like arrays.
en.sc4: Random access to any element in the list is quite easy. Given some position $i$ in the list, the value of the element in that position can be accessed directly through get(i).
en.sc5: Thus, access to any element using the get() method takes constant, or $O(1)$, time.
